definition: a book on the art of war
soldiers/a force/an army/weapons/arms/military/warlike/CL:個|个[ge4]
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write

sentences.english: Even I often find time to read books on the art of war and gain much benefit from them.
sentences.chinese: 我常常抽空阅读兵书，从中得到了不少好处。

sentences.english: Military lexis are scattered throughout all kinds of literature, particularly in military works.
sentences.chinese: 这些词语散见于各种文献，尤以兵书为主。

sentences.english: Even I find time to read books on the art of war, and they've benefited me greatly.
sentences.chinese: 我常常抽空阅读兵书，从中得到了不少好处。

sentences.english: On the third hand the war had enough dialectic thought .
sentences.chinese: 第三章论述先秦兵书所体现的管理学思想。

definition: art of war/military strategy and tactics
“Art of War”, one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1], written by Sun Tzu 孫子|孙子[Sun1 zi3]
“Six Secret Strategic Teachings”, one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1], attributed to Jiang Ziya 姜子牙[Jiang1 Zi3 ya2]
“Methods of Sima”, also called “Sima Rangju’s Art of War”, one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1], written by Sima Rangju 司馬穰苴|司马穰苴[Si1 ma3 Rang2 ju1]
to read intensively
the School of the Military, one of the Hundred Schools of Thought 諸子百家|诸子百家[zhu1 zi3 bai3 jia1] of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
military strategist in ancient China/military commander/soldier
Wei Liaozi, one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1], possibly written by Wei Liao 尉繚|尉缭[Wei4 Liao2] during the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
Mr Zuo's Spring and Autumn Annals, attributed to famous blind historian Zuo Qiuming 左丘明[Zuo3 Qiu1 ming2]/usually called Zuo Zhuan 左傳|左传[Zuo3 Zhuan4]
Sun Bin's "The Art of War"
to lead military operations with extraordinary skill
to read and re-read sth until one is familiar with it
military strategy/military tactics/originally refers to military classics Six Secret Teachings 六韜|六韬[Liu4 tao1] and Three Strategies 三略[San1 lu:e4]
alternative name for ”Three Strategies of Huang Shigong” 黃石公三略|黄石公三略[Huang2 Shi2 gong1 San1 lu:e4], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
stratagem/strategy/resourcefulness
